intro: Thapsus pulverulentum, commonly known as the dusty thapsus, is a rare and little-studied plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely powdered surface, which gives it its common name, and it typically grows in dry, calcareous soils. The plant has a compact stature with small, aromatic leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered in many regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic research.
